benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags - Retrieve account tags

covered: Happy path: GET with valid accountId returns 200 and application/json array of Tag objects; default audit behavior NONE verified (TC01).

Query parameters: includedDeleted true returns deleted tags; audit parameters FULL and MINIMAL return expected audit info; invalid audit value and unknown query params are tested (TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC09, TC10).
Path parameter validation: invalid UUID format, partial UUID, empty and whitespace accountId, and max-length boundary are covered (TC08, TC20, TC21, TC22, TC23).
Error responses: 404 for non-existent account and 400 for invalid input and injection/XSS attempts are covered (TC07, TC08, TC14, TC15).
Authorization negatives: missing and invalid authentication tokens return 401 (TC12, TC13).
Empty response handling: account with no tags returns an empty JSON array (TC06).
Performance and resilience: large dataset and concurrent request scenarios are included (TC16, TC17).
Availability and integration errors: API down and downstream service failures are handled in tests (TC11, TC24).
Regression and backward compatibility: specific regression and legacy client scenarios included (TC18, TC19).
Data consistency: integration consistency test included to ensure latest tag data is returned (TC25).
gaps: Pagination: No tests exercise pagination parameters, page size, offsets, or link headers for large result sets.
Caching behavior: No tests for Cache-Control, ETag, Last-Modified, or conditional GET that would yield 304 Not Modified.
Rate limiting and throttling: No tests simulate rate limit enforcement or validate 429 responses and rate-limit headers; concurrency tests do not assert throttling behavior.
Authorization 403 case: No scenarios for authenticated but forbidden access or insufficient permissions (403).
Schema and contract validation: Tag object schema, field types, required properties, and OpenAPI/JSON Schema conformance are not explicitly validated.
Query parameter type validation gaps: includedDeleted malformed/non-boolean values are not tested; only positive and missing cases are covered.
Content-Type and error body consistency: Only one scenario explicitly checks Content-Type; consistent content-type and structured error bodies are not asserted across all flows.
Concurrency edge cases: No tests for race conditions when tags are added/removed concurrently with read requests leading to snapshot or consistency checks.
recommendations: Add pagination tests to verify page, pageSize or offset/limit behavior, total count reporting and next/prev link headers when results are large.
Add caching tests to assert Cache-Control and ETag headers and to exercise conditional GETs that should return 304 Not Modified when appropriate.
Add rate-limiting tests that simulate high request rates to validate 429 responses, Retry-After headers, and graceful degradation under throttling.
Add authorization tests for 403 Forbidden by exercising authenticated users lacking required roles or scopes to ensure proper RBAC enforcement.
Add schema/contract tests that validate each Tag object against the API schema (types, required fields, nullability) using JSON Schema or OpenAPI validation tools.
Add negative query parameter tests for includedDeleted with non-boolean values and for malformed audit values beyond the invalid audit test to ensure robust validation and clear error messages.
Expand Content-Type and error body assertions across all success and error scenarios to ensure consistent producer contract application/json and structured error payloads.
Add concurrency edge-case tests where tags are modified during retrieval to verify snapshot semantics or acceptable eventual consistency behavior.
Include server error tests for internal failures (500) and assert observability signals and clear error messaging for troubleshooting.
Define and enforce performance SLAs in tests (response time, memory) and assert them in large dataset and concurrency scenarios.
